segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati gotamake cetiye.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Gotamaka Tree-shrine.
There the Buddha addressed the mendicants,
“Mendicants, I teach based on direct knowledge, not without direct knowledge.

segments.pli: Sanidānāhaṃ, bhikkhave, dhammaṃ desemi, no anidānaṃ.
segments.en: I teach with reasons, not without them.

segments.pli: Sappāṭihāriyāhaṃ, bhikkhave, dhammaṃ desemi, no appāṭihāriyaṃ.
segments.en: I teach with a demonstrable basis, not without it.

segments.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhave, abhiññāya dhammaṃ desayato no anabhiññāya, sanidānaṃ dhammaṃ desayato no anidānaṃ, sappāṭihāriyaṃ dhammaṃ desayato no appāṭihāriyaṃ, karaṇīyo ovādo, karaṇīyā anusāsanī.
segments.en: Since this is so, you should follow my advice and instruction.

segments.pli: Alañca pana vo, bhikkhave, tuṭṭhiyā, alaṃ attamanatāya, alaṃ somanassāya:
segments.en: This is enough for you to feel joyful, delighted, and happy:
‘The Blessed One is a fully awakened Buddha! The teaching is well explained! The Saṅgha is practicing well!’”
That is what the Buddha said.

segments.pli: Attamanā te bhikkhū bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinandunti.
segments.en: Satisfied, the mendicants were happy with what the Buddha said.

segments.pli: Imasmiñca pana veyyākaraṇasmiṃ bhaññamāne sahassī lokadhātu akampitthāti.
segments.en: And while this discourse was being spoken, the galaxy shook.

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī,…

suttaplex.blurb: The Buddha teaches a simple but powerful message: his teaching is from personal experience, and it works.
